Genua och vithet i den intersektionella vändingen
It’s All in the Family: Intersections of Gender, Race, and Nation

60 Especially African-American women in the USA started to question academic feminists’ focus on the oppression of women, arguing that gender could not be studied in isolation. The critique of white feminism’s hegemony and exclusive practice was strongly articulated in Kimberlé Crenshaw, Demarginalizing the Intersection of Race and Sex: A Black Feminist Critique of Antidiscrimination Doctrine
For a critical presentation of how intersectionality relates to feminist theory, see Paulina De los Reyes and Diana Mulinari, Intersektionalitet: Kritiska reflektioner över (o)jämlikhetens landskap
